meanings.sent1: She kept saturating the sponge with water until it couldn't hold any more.
meanings.sent2: The rain was saturating the dry soil, making it muddy.
meanings.sent3: The sponge was so saturating that it started dripping water everywhere!
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was saturating every conversation he had.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting were saturating the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To supply with as much as possible
meanings.sent1: The generous host was saturating the guests with delicious food and drinks.
meanings.sent2: The company was saturating the market with their new product, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was saturating the students with knowledge, leaving them eager to learn more.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was saturating every interaction, making everyone feel valued.
meanings.sent5: The music festival was saturating the town with joy and excitement.

meanings.definition: To cause to become full or soaked
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was saturating the clothes hanging outside on the line.
meanings.sent2: The chef was saturating the pasta with rich, flavorful sauce.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so emotional that it was saturating the audience with tears.
meanings.sent4: The scent of fresh flowers was saturating the room, creating a pleasant atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of baking bread was saturating the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
